III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
Description and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Care Worker used derogatory language in describing the
parents of Youth A.
Investigation It was alleged the foster parents of Youth A used derogatory
language in describing the parents of Youth A by allegedly
describing the parents as "stupid, retarded, and slow" while
standing outside the day care program used by the foster parents
for Youth A.
Interviews:
I interviewed Certification Worker by telephone on 8/19/2024.
Certification Worker is employed by the agency as a foster home
certification employee. Certification Worker stated the agency had
received 5 complaints on the same foster home since July and
special investigations by the agency of the foster home
determined no findings supporting the allegations.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker by telephone on 8/19/2024.
Foster Care Worker denied Foster Care Worker, or the foster
parents of Youth A ever used any demeaning or derogatory
language in describing the parents of Youth A. Foster Care
Worker stated the foster care case for Youth A was currently in
the process of possible termination of parental rights for Youth A.
Foster Care Worker provided contact information regarding the
day care facility that is used by the foster parents for Youth A.
I interviewed Day Care Director by telephone on 8/19/2024. Day
Care Director denied ever hearing the foster parents of Youth A or
Foster Care Worker use any derogatory/demeaning language in
describing the parents of Youth A. Foster Care Director
subsequently interviewed other day care staff, and they all denied
ever hearing the foster parents or Foster Care Worker use any
inappropriate language in describing the parents of Youth A.
Three attempts were made to contact Foster Parent 1 and Foster
Parent 2 to confirm their denial of using any inappropriate
language in describing the parents of Youth A, but no interviews
were able to be completed.
The intake for this complaint/allegation was anonymous and no
complainant was identified.
Documents Reviewed:
2

I reviewed two special evaluations of this foster home dated
7/12/2024 and 8/30/2024 and neither of these investigations
determined any violations/noncompliance.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with Rule 400.12206-2.
Interviews that were completed and documents that were
reviewed determined no evidence to substantiate the allegations
as reported.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Special evaluation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12327
Section (1) Upon receipt of any information that relates to possible
Description noncompliance with any foster home rule, the agency must do all
the following:
(c) Conduct an evaluation, in cooperation with child protective
services, when applicable, including all necessary collateral
contacts.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Parents used derogatory language in describing the
parents of Youth A.
Investigation The same methodologies, interviews, and documents reviewed in
assessing compliance for Rule 400.12206-2 were utilized and
completed to determine compliance with this rule. The primary
focus of compliance related to Rule 400.12327-1-c was to
determine if the agency had completed special evaluations on the
identified foster home regarding previously reported allegations.
The special evaluation documents reviewed confirmed the agency
had completed special evaluations as required by this rule.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with Rule 400.12327-1-c. The
special evaluation documents reviewed confirmed the agency had
completed special evaluations as required by this rule.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
3

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
